intro: Campylanthera ericoides, commonly known as the heath campylanthera, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes heathers and blueberries, and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and compact growth habit. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically pink or white, arranged in clusters at the ends of its branches. It thrives in acidic, well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
